DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Effects Cardiovascular Risk Factors Korean American Dietary Profiles
DOC.criteria: Non AsianAmerican men woman age 2565 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≥ 25 ≤ 38 kg/m2 Fasting LDLcholesterol ≥ 130 mg/dL Willingness ability make schedule appointment clinical site require study protocol Major aversion Korean food Known food allergy would interfere study protocol Use cholesterollowering medication dietary supplement Use blood pressure medication Use prebiotics probiotic last 3 month Received medication bacterial infection ( antibiotic ) last 3 month Regular use fiber supplement laxatives Conditions require ongoing medical care and/or medication , include kidney , liver , gastrointestinal endocrine disorder . Regular tobacco use within 6 month prior start study History eat disorder dietary pattern consistent dietary intervention ( e.g. , vegetarian , low fat diet , high protein diet ) Voluntary involuntary weight loss 10 % body weight within last 12 month Selfreport alcohol substance abuse within past 12 month Donated blood 8 week period prior study Other medical , psychiatric , behavioral factor judgment Principal Investigator may interfere study anticipation ability follow intervention protocol
